summary: This is an email chain from November 28-29, 2021, containing a motivational message from an Assistant United States Attorney to colleagues regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It frames the trial as a pursuit of justice for historical sex crimes and provides logistical details for the opening day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the core email, motivating the prosecution team for the Maxwell trial, stating it's never too late for justice and that brave women will testify.

connections.description: The AUSA is prosecuting Maxwell in the referenced criminal case, seeking to hold her accountable for alleged sex crimes.

events.title: Opening of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin with peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Florida (mentioned as a contrast to SDNY's approach)
keyFacts: The document is a prosecutorial team email expressing confidence and framing the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as a historic pursuit of justice for sex crimes dating back to 1994.
It alleges that Ghislaine Maxwell 'sexually exploited underage girls' and 'caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable kids.'
The trial is set to begin with opening statements on November 29, 2021, at the SDNY courthouse (40 Foley Square), with multiple overflow courtrooms arranged.
The email contrasts the Southern District of New York's willingness to prosecute old cases with an implied criticism of prosecutors elsewhere (specifically referencing Florida).
It indicates that 'brave women will take the witness stand' to testify against Maxwell.
